title: Love Island's Ovie Soko and India Reynolds in crisis talks on verge of split
text:

Ovie Soko and India Reynolds are on the verge of splitting just three months after finding themselves in the Love Island final.

Basketball playe Ovie found love with lingerie model India during the last couple of weeks of the ITV show, having been pied off by Anna Vakili.

And now the pair are said to be "on the rocks" and staging crisis talks about the state of their relationship.

"It's clear things aren't exactly rosy between them. They need time to meet up and work things out," an insider told Mail Online .

The reality stars, both 28, are said to be meeting up this weekend to work out once and for all what they want to do.

(Image: WP Pix / SplashNews.com)

A second source added: "They have been trying to get together all week, but their busy work schedules haven't permitted it."

Speculation was sparked over their relationship status as it has been four weeks since they were last pictured together.

And Ovie hasn't appeared on India's Instagram page since August 18 - two whole months.

Likewise, the sports star hasn't shared any snaps of his so-called girlfriend since August 1.

They were last seen together in public at the TV Choice Awards on September 9, but are yet to publicly confirm or deny their split.

(Image: Getty Images)

The pair came in third in the Love Island final, losing out to Amber Gill and Greg O'Shea - who split just five weeks after winning the £50,000 cash prize - and Molly-Mae Hague and Tommy Fury, who are still going strong.

In his last interview, Ovie denied reports India had cheated on him with footballer Kieran Gibbs, 29, at his birthday celebrations in Ibiza.

"Me and India are happy. I think that's definitely the most important thing. We're very happy," he insisted to Mail Online.

"Regardless of how many people [there are] in every one of our lives, there will be opinions. And everyone can have their own opinion."

(Image: Beretta/Sims/REX)

India also hit back at the cheating claims, adding: "We've had a week of nightmare things. There was one [rumour] last week and then yesterday there was another. Can we have a break? Can we just live, please?

"We've been absolutely fine, but obviously it's not nice. The worst thing is – something coming out in the paper is one thing, we know it's not true and we can just get over that – but it's all the people on Instagram that start sending you horrible messages."

She added that Kieran and his brother were family friends and she had known them both for years.

"It was their 30th birthday so I was there with loads of friends and family. There's nothing about it! It got blown into a ridiculous thing," she said.
description: Ovie Soko and India Reynolds are said to be 'on the rocks' three months after the end of Love Island
